content.question: Which of the following identifies the four species that are present in an aqueous solution of the weak acid <math alttext="H 2 C 2 O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>, from the highest to the lowest concentration at equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="H 3 O with a positive 1 charge, is greater than H C 2 O 4 with a negative 1 charge, which is greater than C 2 O 4 with a negative 2 charge, which is greater than H 2 C 2 O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mtext>HC</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="H 3 O with a positive 1 charge, is greater than C 2 O 4 with a negative 2 charge, which is greater than H C 2 O 4 with a negative 1 charge, which is greater than H 2 C 2 O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msup><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mtext>HC</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="H 2 C 2 O 4 is greater than H C 2 O 4 with a negative 1 charge, which is greater than C 2 O 4 with a negative 2 charge, which is greater than H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mtext>HC</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msup><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>

<math alttext="H 2 C 2 O 4 is greater than H 3 O with a positive 1 charge, which is greater than H C 2 O 4 with a negative 1 charge, which is greater than C 2 O 4 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mtext>HC</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H 2 C 2 O 4 is greater than H 3 O with a positive 1 charge, which is greater than H C 2 O 4 with a negative 1 charge, which is greater than C 2 O 4 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mtext>HC</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math>

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
